> <OLD - WHEELIE>
>
> At this point, noticing where the optics were coming from, WHEELIE turned
> over to face them, casually chiming, "Friends find, look behind."  And then
> taking out his energon goodies over to hold them up in his hand, "Bah weep
> graaagnah wheep ni ni bong.  It's the universal greeting, or so they say.
> Why don't you come out now and play?"
>
> The goodies held in his off hand, as if offering.  So his plan was if the
> entity was friendly, it would see the goodies and hopefullyb e relaxed by
> them. A nd if it was threatening or moved in to attack, then he could use
> his main hand to whip out his slingshot to use the goodies for an extra
> 'burst' of ammo to shoot over at it for an added punch to get himself room
> to fight!
>
> "Why don';t you come out to play?  We can have some fun this way!"

<NEW>

There was a pause as the optics that examined WHEELIE seemed to watch
him carefully. There was no sound only an intensity and perhaps even a
curiousity.

Then the optics wink out as if a light switch had been shut off
leaving WHEELIE alone again, or at least apparently alone.


> <OLD - Tuscon>
>
> Cautiously standing a good distance away from the figure, Tucson slowly
> draws his sword, and keeps it in hand with the blade faced to the ground.
> Slowly, he walks toward the figure.
>
> " Hello, are you in need of help?"

There is the sound as something rustled in the leaves and brush a good
distance ahead and then stopped. Then there was the sound of something
sparking or buzzing and then it too fell silent.

TUSCON as he approached was begining to detect something that smelled
distinctly like lubricant. He was still perhaps 30 yards from whatever
it was when he came to a clearing, if it could be called a clearing.
Noonday sun splashed down on a fallen tree, an explosion of
undergrowth was already trying to come up around the tree. It was
perhaps a few days old, but already weeds and grasses and even a few
small trees were climbing upwards, fed by the rich soil of the jungle
floor.

It was on the otherside of a clearing from TUSCON, tucked into brush
and thick undergrowth was whatever it was that TUSCON had detected.
The smell of lubricant was definitly detectable.

(TAG)

Preston
